required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Tobacco, Alcohol, Prescription Medication and Other Substances Tool
clinical_study.official_title: The TAPS Tool: Screen and Brief Assessment Tool Validation Study

collaborator.agency: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to develop and validate a questionnaire to screen and assess adult primary care patients for tobacco, alcohol, prescription drug, and drug use and problems related to their use.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study examined the accuracy of a substance abuse screening test compared to gold standard measures Participants all received the experimental screening instrument (via self- and tablet computer administration. The order of administration was randomly selected in order to control for an order effect.

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-5 (DSM-5) Alcohol Use Disorder Diagnosis Measured by the Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview
primary_outcome.description: The Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview is a structured interview that assesses whether or not the participant meets DSM-5 Diagnostic Criteria

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-5 (DSM-5) Cannabis Use Disorder Diagnosis Measured With Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview
primary_outcome.description: The Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview is a structured interview that assesses whether or not the participant meets DSM-5 Diagnostic Criteria

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-5 (DSM-5) Cocaine and Amphetamine (Stimulant) Use Disorder Diagnosis Measured by the Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview
primary_outcome.description: The Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview is a structured interview that assesses whether or not the participant meets DSM-5 Diagnostic Criteria

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual DSM-5 Diagnosis of Heroin Use Disorder Measured by the The Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview
primary_outcome.description: The Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview is a structured interview that assesses whether or not the participant meets DSM-5 Diagnostic Criteria

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual DSM-5 Diagnosis of Tobacco Use Disorder Measured by the Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview
primary_outcome.description: The Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview is a structured interview that assesses whether or not the participant meets DSM-5 Diagnostic Criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: High Risk Tobacco Use Measured by the Alcohol, Smoking, and Substance Involvement Screening Test (ASSIST)
secondary_outcome.description: The ASSIST assess lifetime and past 3 month substance use. A score on the Tobacco Scale from 0-3 is low risk, 4-26 is medium risk, and 27 or greater is high risk.The scales range is from 0 (no problem) to 31 (most severe problem).

The Time Line Follow Back Interview measures participant's self-reported number of days of cannabis use in the 30 days prior to the interview. Unhealthy cannabis use is considered 1 or more days of cannabis use in the past 30 days.

Measured by the Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test - Consumption Items. High risk on the AUDIT-C is 10 or higher. The higher the score on the AUDIT-C the greater the alcohol problem.The range of scores on the AUDIT-C is from 0 (no problem) to 12 (maximum problem).
Measured by the Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence. The range of scores on the Fagerstrom Test if from 0 (no risk) to 10 (highest risk). High risk is considered a score of 6 or greater.
Any yes response to smokeless tobacco use reported on the smokeless tobacco questionnaire is considered high risk.

arm_group.description: All participants were administered the TAPS Tool via interviewer and tablet computer self-administration in the same session.

intervention.intervention_name: Interviewer and tablet administration of the TAPS Tool
intervention.description: All participant will self-administer substance use screening instrument (TAPS Tool) on a tablet computer and will be administered the TAPS Tool by an interviewer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary care patients
- Able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- inability to comprehend spoken English
- inability to self-administer the instrument on the tablet computer due to physical limitations
- previously enrolled in the study

facility.name: Virginia Commonwealth University Health System Ambulatory Care Center

group.title: Interviewer Then Tablet Administration
group.description: Interviewer will administer the substance use screening instrument first then self-administration of the same instrument on a tablet computer

group.title: Tablet First Then Interviewer Administration
group.description: Self-administration on tablet computer of screening instrument first, then interviewer administration of the same instrument.

group.title: Interviewer and Tablet Administration of TAPS Tool
group.description: All participants self-administered TAPS Tool on a computer tablet and were administered the TAPS Tool by an interviewer

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.population: Missing data (n=1) and refused to answer (n=1)

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-5 (DSM-5) Alcohol Use Disorder Diagnosis Measured by the Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview
outcome.description: The Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview is a structured interview that assesses whether or not the participant meets DSM-5 Diagnostic Criteria

group.title: Interviewer Administration
group.description: Interviewer administration of a substance misuse screening instrument (TAPS Tool).

group.title: Tablet Administration
group.description: Self-administration on tablet computer of screening instrument for substance misuse (TAPS Tool).

measure.title: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-5 (DSM-5) Alcohol Use Disorder Diagnosis Measured by the Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview
measure.description: The Modified World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview is a structured interview that assesses whether or not the participant meets DSM-5 Diagnostic Criteria

analysis.groups_desc: Each administration approach (interviewer and tablet) was tested separately against the reference measure.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Concurrent validity of the interviewer and self-administered versions of the TAPS Tool compared to the reference standard was assessed for Alcohol Use Disorder using receiver operator characteristic (ROC) curves.

analysis.groups_desc: Each administration approach (interviewer and tablet) was tested separately against the reference measure.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Concurrent validity of the interviewer and self-administered versions of the TAPS Tool compared to the reference standard was assessed for Alcohol Use Disorder using receiver operator characteristic (ROC) curves.

outcome.title: High Risk Tobacco Use Measured by the Alcohol, Smoking, and Substance Involvement Screening Test (ASSIST)
outcome.description: The ASSIST assess lifetime and past 3 month substance use. A score on the Tobacco Scale from 0-3 is low risk, 4-26 is medium risk, and 27 or greater is high risk.The scales range is from 0 (no problem) to 31 (most severe problem).

group.title: Interviewer Administered
group.description: Interviewer administration of TAPS Tool. The ASSIST was interviewer administered as well.

group.title: Tablet Administration
group.description: Tablet computer administration of TAPS Tool. The ASSIST was administered in by an interview.

measure.title: High Risk Tobacco Use Measured by the Alcohol, Smoking, and Substance Involvement Screening Test (ASSIST)
measure.description: The ASSIST assess lifetime and past 3 month substance use. A score on the Tobacco Scale from 0-3 is low risk, 4-26 is medium risk, and 27 or greater is high risk.The scales range is from 0 (no problem) to 31 (most severe problem).

outcome.title: Unhealthy Cannabis Use
outcome.description: The Time Line Follow Back Interview measures participant's self-reported number of days of cannabis use in the 30 days prior to the interview. Unhealthy cannabis use is considered 1 or more days of cannabis use in the past 30 days.

group.title: Interviewer Administered
group.description: Interviewer administered TAPS. The Time Line Follow Back was interviewer administered.

group.title: Tablet Administration
group.description: Tablet computer administration of TAPS Tool. The TLFB was interviewer administered.

measure.title: Unhealthy Cannabis Use
measure.description: The Time Line Follow Back Interview measures participant's self-reported number of days of cannabis use in the 30 days prior to the interview. Unhealthy cannabis use is considered 1 or more days of cannabis use in the past 30 days.

outcome.title: Risky Alcohol Use
outcome.description: Measured by the Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test - Consumption Items. High risk on the AUDIT-C is 10 or higher. The higher the score on the AUDIT-C the greater the alcohol problem.The range of scores on the AUDIT-C is from 0 (no problem) to 12 (maximum problem).

group.title: Self-administered
group.description: Self-administered TAPS Tool. The AUDIT-C was interviewer administered.

group.title: Interviewer Administered
group.description: Interviewer administered TAPS Tool. The AUDIT-C was interviewer administered for both group

measure.title: Risky Alcohol Use
measure.description: Measured by the Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test - Consumption Items. High risk on the AUDIT-C is 10 or higher. The higher the score on the AUDIT-C the greater the alcohol problem.The range of scores on the AUDIT-C is from 0 (no problem) to 12 (maximum problem).

analysis.groups_desc: Each administration approach (interviewer and tablet) were tested separately against the reference measure.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The association on the interviewer and tablet computer administered versions of the TAPS Tool compared to the reference standard AUDIT-C score was assessed using Spearman Correlation.
analysis.estimate_desc: The estimated value is a Spearman Correlation point estimate between TAPS Tool Alcohol Score and the AUDIT-C score. A Confidence Interval rather than a dispersion value is therefore reported.

analysis.groups_desc: Each administration approach (interviewer and tablet) was tested separately against the reference measure.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The association on the interviewer and tablet administered versions of the TAPS Tool compared to the reference standard of the AUDIT C score was assessed using Spearman Correlation.
analysis.estimate_desc: The estimated value is a Spearman Correlation point estimate between TAPS Tool Alcohol Score and the AUDIT-C Score. A Confidence Interval rather than a dispersion value is therefore reported.

outcome.title: Cigarette Smoking Risk
outcome.description: Measured by the Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence. The range of scores on the Fagerstrom Test if from 0 (no risk) to 10 (highest risk). High risk is considered a score of 6 or greater.

group.title: Self-administered TAPS Tool
group.description: Self-administered TAPS Tool. The Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence was administered by interviewer.

group.title: Interviewer Administered
group.description: Interviewer administered TAPS Tool. The Fagerstrom Test was interviewer administered.

measure.title: Cigarette Smoking Risk
measure.description: Measured by the Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence. The range of scores on the Fagerstrom Test if from 0 (no risk) to 10 (highest risk). High risk is considered a score of 6 or greater.

outcome.title: Smokeless Tobacco Questionnaire
outcome.description: Any yes response to smokeless tobacco use reported on the smokeless tobacco questionnaire is considered high risk.

group.title: Interviewer Administered
group.description: Interviewer administered TAPS Tool. The Smokeless Tobacco Questionnaire was interviewer administered.

group.title: Self Administered
group.description: Self-administered TAPS Tool. The Smokeless Tobacco Questionnaire was interviewer administered.

measure.title: Smokeless Tobacco Questionnaire
measure.description: Any yes response to smokeless tobacco use reported on the smokeless tobacco questionnaire is considered high risk.

analysis.groups_desc: Each administration approach (interviewer and tablet computer) was tested separately against the reference measure.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The association on the interviewer and tablet computer administered versions of the TAPS Tool compared to the reference standard Smokeless Tobacco Questionnaire was assessed using Spearman Correlation.
analysis.estimate_desc: The estimated value is a Spearman Correlation point estimate between the TAPS Tool Tobacco Score and the Smokeless Tobacco Questionnare. Confidence Interval rather than a dispersion value is therefore reported.

analysis.groups_desc: Each administration approach (interviewer and tablet) were tested separately against the reference measure.
analysis.estimate_desc: The estimated value is a Spearman Correlation point estimate between TAPS Tool Tobacco Score and the score on the Smokeless Tobacco Questionnaire. A Confidence Interval rather than a dispersion value is therefore reported.

outcome.title: Cannabis Positive Oral Fluid Test
outcome.population: Adult Primary Care Patients with oral fluid test results

group.title: Interviewer Administered
group.description: Interviewer administered TAPS Tool. Oral Fluid Cannabis Test administered to the subset of participants that consented to provide an oral fluid sample. Oral fluid specimen was collected the same way in both arms.

group.title: Self-administered TAPS Tool
group.description: Self administered TAPS Tool. Oral Fluid Cannabis Test administered to the subset of participants that consented to provide an oral fluid sample. Oral fluid specimen was collected the same way in both arms.

measure.title: Cannabis Positive Oral Fluid Test
measure.population: Adult Primary Care Patients with oral fluid test results

analysis.groups_desc: Each administration approach (interviewer and tablet) were tested separately against the reference measure.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The association on the interviewer and tablet computer administered versions of the TAPS Tool compared to the reference standard of the results of the oral fluid test was assessed using Spearman Correlation.
analysis.estimate_desc: The estimated value is a Spearman Correlation point estimate between TAPS Tool Cannabis Score and the results of the Oral Fluid Test. Confidence Interval rather than a dispersion value is therefore reported.

The estimated value is a point estimate of the Spearman Correlation between the TAPS Tool Cannabis Score and the Oral Fluid Cannabis Screen. A Confidence Interval rather than a dispersion value is therefore reported.

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline data only gathered in this study.
reported_events.desc: The all cause mortality and serious adverse event data refer to the total combined sample (n = 2,000). We report the total sample here because all participants received both the interviewer and self-administered versions one immediately after the other in one single session.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All participants enrolled in the study (because all participants were administered both the self-administered and the interviewer administered versions of the instrument, we are reporting adverse events for the total sample)

event.description: Traces of blood were seen on oral swab

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
